title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: The graph of <math alttext="f double prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the second derivative of the function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, is shown above on the interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, below the origin. It moves downward and to the right at first, and reaches a local minimum at a point below the x axis, approximately halfway between x equals 1 and x equals 2. At this point, it moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis approximately halfway between x equals 4 and x equals 5, and begins to level off as it approaches a point high above the x axis, where x equals 8.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, far below the origin. It moves upward and to the right at first, crossing the x axis just to the left of 1, and reaches a local maximum at a point high above the x axis, where x equals 2. At this point, it moves downward and to the right, crossing the x axis 4, and reaches a local minimum below the x axis, just to the right of x equals 5. It then moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis at 7, and begins to level off as is ends a point just above the x axis, where x equals 8.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, below the origin. It moves downward and to the right at first, and reaches a local minimum at a point below the x axis, just to the left of x equals 1. At this point, it moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis just to the right of 2, and reaches a local maximum high above the x axis, where x equals 4. Then, the curve moves downward and to the right until it reaches a local minimum just above the x axis, where x equals 7. It then moves upward and to the right, and ends a point above the x axis, where x equals 8.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, far below the origin. It moves downward and to the right at first, and reaches a local minimum at a point below the x axis, approximately halfway between the y axis and x equals 1. At this point, it moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis just to the right of 1, and reaches a local maximum high above the x axis, where x equals 2. Then, the curve moves downward and to the right, crossing the x axis just to the right of 3, until it reaches a local minimum just below the x axis, approximately halfway between x equals 3 and x equals 4. It then moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis just to the left of 4, and reaches a local maximum above the x axis at x equals 5. It then moves downward and to the right, and reaches a local minimum just above the x axis just to the left of x equals 7. It moves upward and to the right again until it begins to level off just above the x axis, where x equals 8.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 1 is indicated on the x axis. The curve begins on the y axis, below the origin. It moves downward and to the right at first, and reaches a local minimum at a point below the x axis, just to the left of x equals 1. At this point, it moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis just to the right of 2, and reaches a local maximum high above the x axis, where x equals 4. Then, the curve moves downward and to the right until it reaches a local minimum just above the x axis, where x equals 7. It then moves upward and to the right, and ends a point above the x axis, where x equals 8.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
